com.software.reuze

Class gb_WETriangleMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.gb_TriangleMesh
      • com.software.reuze.gb_WETriangleMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gb_i_Intersector, gb_i_Mesh

    public class gb_WETriangleMesh
extends gb_TriangleMesh
    A class to dynamically build, manipulate & export triangle meshes. Meshes are built face by face. The class automatically re-uses existing vertices and can create smooth vertex normals. Vertices and faces are directly accessible for speed & convenience.

    • Field Summary

      • gb_WETriangleMesh

        public gb_WETriangleMesh(String name)
        Creates a new mesh instance with initial default buffer sizes.
        Parameters:
        name - mesh name

      • gb_WETriangleMesh

        public gb_WETriangleMesh(String name,
                 int numV,
                 int numF)
        Creates a new mesh instance with the given initial buffer sizes. These numbers are no limits and the mesh can be smaller or grow later on. They're only used to initialize the underlying collections.
        Parameters:
        name - mesh name
        numV - initial vertex buffer size
        numF - initial face list size

        public gb_WETriangleMesh pointTowards(gb_Vector3 dir)
        Rotates the mesh in such a way so that its "forward" axis is aligned with the given direction. This version uses the positive Z-axis as default forward direction.
        Overrides:

      • transform

        public gb_WETriangleMesh transform(m_Matrix4 mat,
                          boolean updateNormals)
        Applies the given matrix transform to all mesh vertices. If the updateNormals flag is true, all face normals are updated automatically, however vertex normals still need a manual update.
        Overrides:
        transform in class gb_TriangleMesh
